Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2009 02:41AM AusMum wrote: Good work Shannon - get to the breast specialist and go from there. Like others say - more likely than not it's nothing. I was just told this morning my lump was just an inflamed duct! (Results of excisional biopsy)
Posts.Title: Lump is actually breast tissue? Shannon-GA Shannon-GA

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2009 02:04AM AusMum wrote: BENIGN!!!!!!!!!!!! Turns out I had an inflamed breast duct. Didn't even know that was a possibility but apparently so. So no more dr's appts or anything now. All done. What a relief!! I would like to thanks all your absolutely lovely responses. It is so nice to know you are here to help. It has really really helped after the last few weeks of hell. Love and prayers to you all.
Posts.Title: New and on emotional rollercoaster AusMum vivvygirl

Posts.Content: AusMum wrote: Hi everyone, I'm 33 from Western Australia. Was at the gyn for another matter a few weeks ago and asked him to do a breast check while I was there. He found a lump and told me to wait until my next period was over to see if it was just hormonal. Course I couldn't wait so went to the GP. She couldn't find lump. sent me to have ultrasound/mammogram anyway. Had that on the Tues. They found lump and it wasn't cyst. (6mm) Booked in for following day for fine needle biopsy. Had that on the Wed. Got results on the Fri from GP - biopsy inconclusive. Was quite upset as basically thought I'd have the results (yay or nay - not further tests to find out. Referred to breast specialist/surgeon. Saw specialist yesterday. He advised get lump removed and tested. Booked in for that next Wed. Will the results of that biopsy be able to determine the grade of cancer IF it is cancer?? The whole thing has been an awful emotional rollercoaster. I've been pretty upbeat most of the time but yesterday I must admit I was getting pretty down about it all and today hasn't been much better. My biggest fear is my small children not having a mother and that sort of thing - irrational at this point in time but hard not to think about. Thanks for reading! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New and on emotional rollercoaster AusMum vivvygirl

Posts.Content: Jul 9, 2009 12:16AM AusMum wrote: Thank you so much for all your lovely replies ladies. The encouragement is just fantastic considering I am utterly fed up with the whole medical profession. Their communication has been quite disappointing to say the least. I just had my lumpectomy yesterday and that ice suggestion sounds like a good one! (Course no one at the hospital told me that). Don't get the results for 2 weeks...more waiting! Arghhhh!!!

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2009 03:55AM AusMum wrote: hi girls, hopefully getting my results tomorrow - it would have been 12 days post-surgery and i've had enough of the waiting. i'm still in quite a bit of pain from the lumpectomy so even if the surgeon can't give me the path results tomorrow at least he can check the site etc. i've already had one very stubborn infection post-FNA so i am hoping i haven't developed another one!
